oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Uniform group of Pvt. Joseph W. Knox
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The coat of Pvt. Joseph William Knox, Co. E, 11th Inf. Regt., is of the simplified M1917 pattern. It has collar discs, a 5th Division patch, A red discharge chevron and two overseas chevrons on the left sleeve. Breeches are private purchase with button closure at the calves. The overseas cap has an infantry disc with "E" below crossed rifles. Puttees and British made helmet complete the grouping. Knox served in the Meuse-Argonne offensive in France. [See also GWjack018-024, 500-516]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
